title: Why GNOME?
para: Why choose GNOME over other desktop environments? Here are some of the reasons we work on GNOME.

sect2.title: Usability.
sect2.para: GNOME is one of the few open source projects to take a stand for end user usability over geeky hyper-configurability. Our User Interface Guidelines, developed by a team of UI professionals, are the most complete guidelines yet from the open source community.

sect2.title: Accessibility.
sect2.para: Many governments, including the US government, require comprehensive accessibility support in software they purchase. After dozens of person-years of effort, GNOME is the only free software desktop to address this issue (with nice side effects for all users, such as full keyboard navigation).

sect2.title: Performance.
sect2.para: GNOME 2.0 and 2.2 are smaller and faster than previous versions of GNOME, a welcome trend.

sect2.title: Applications.
sect2.para: Popular applications such as Mozilla, Galeon, Evolution, OpenOffice, GAIM, X-Chat, XMMS, Gnumeric, AbiWord, and more are based on GTK+, or affiliated with the GNOME Project via member companies.

sect2.title: Licensing.
sect2.para: Developing for the GTK+ platform is 100% free of license fees.

sect2.title: Support.
sect2.para: Active contributors to GNOME development include Red Hat, Sun Microsystems, and Ximian, all established experts who can help with your enterprise UNIX or Linux deployment.
